AppicationSubmissionInfo.FormAndInfoAndMaterials: THE SHAW-BURCKHARDT-BRENNER FOUNDATION DOES NOT PROVIDE A STANDARD APPLICATION FORMAT. HOWEVER, THE BOARD LOOKS FOR CERTAIN ELEMENTS IN EACH GRANT REQUEST AND PARTICULARLY ONE THAT RELATES TO THE FUNDING OF A SPECIFIC PROGRAM OR PROJECT. THESE ARE: 1. DETAILED AND SPECIFIC INFORMATION OF A PROGRAM'S PURPOSE AND PROCEDURE, PERSONNEL INVOLVED, ANTICIPATED RESULTS, EVALUATION PROCEDURES, ETC. 2. A DETAILED BUDGET TO JUSTIFY THE AMOUNT REQUESTED WHICH IDENTIFIES ALL PROJECTED EXPENSES AND ANTICIPATED INCOME ASSOCIATED WITH THE PROGRAM AND A COPY OF THE MOST CURRENT FINANCIAL STATEMENT OF THE ORGANIZATION. 3. VISUAL MATERIALS, CHARTS, SUPPORT LETTERS, AND ANY OTHER APPROPRIATE INFORMATION TO SUPPORT THE GRANT REQUEST. 4. A COPY OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE DETERMINATION LETTER INDICATING THAT THE APPLYING ORGANIZATION HAS APPROPRIATE TAX-EXEMPT STATUS. UNLESS THIS INFORMATION WAS PREVIOUSLY FURNISHED, THE BOARD CANNOT CONSIDER A REQUEST WITHOUT THIS EVIDENCE. 5. A COPY OF THE MOST RECENT
AppicationSubmissionInfo.SubmissionDeadlines: GENERALLY, THE BOARD MEETS TWO TIMES A YEAR, IN MAY AND NOVEMBER/DECEMBER. GRANT REQUESTS RECEIVED A
AppicationSubmissionInfo.RestrictionsOnAwards: THE BOARD FAVORS PROGRAMS WHICH BENEFIT CHILDREN (OR PROVIDE SERVICES TO CHILDREN) OVER OTHER PROGRAMS, AND THE BOARD PREFERS TO CONSIDER GRANT REQUESTS FOR THE FUNDING OF SPECIFIC PROGRAMS OR PROJECTS BEFORE CONSIDERING REQUESTS FOR GENERAL OPERATING FUNDS.

GeneralExplanation.Explanation: ELECTION UNDER REGULATIONS SECTION EXCESS QUALIFYING DISTRIBUTIONS AS PURSUANT TO IRC SECTION 4942(H)(2) FOUNDATION HEREBY ELECTS TO TREAT C EXCESS OF THE IMMEDIATELY PRECEDING BEING MADE OUT OF CORPUS.
